required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 3b, Randomized, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of Select Travel Vaccines When Administered Concomitantly With MenACWY in Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3b, Randomized, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of Select Travel Vaccines When Administered Concomitantly With Novartis Meningococcal ACWY Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares the safety and immunogenicity profile of several travel vaccines given alone or concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM to healthy adults.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Anti-typhoid Vi Antibody Concentrations
primary_outcome.description: Assessment was made to demonstrate the non-inferiority of the geometric mean anti-typhoid Vi antibody concentrations, 28 days after the vaccination of typhoid Vi polysaccharide (TF) and yellow fever (YF) vaccines given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 to typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccines given alone in healthy adults aged ≥18 years to ≤60 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Anti-Yellow Fever Antibody Titer
primary_outcome.description: Assessment was made to demonstrate the non-inferiority of the geometric mean anti-yellow fever antibody titers, 28 days after the vaccination of typhoid Vi polysaccharide (TF) and yellow fever (YF) vaccines given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 to typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccines given alone in healthy adults aged ≥18 years to ≤60 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Anti-Japanese Encephalitis Neutralizing Antibody Titers
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 57).
primary_outcome.description: Assessment was made to demonstrate the non-inferiority of the geometric mean anti-Japanese encephalitis neutralizing antibody titers, 28 days after the vaccination of the second dose of Japanese Encephalitis vaccine and third dose of the rabies virus vaccine given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 or alone in healthy adults aged ≥18 years to ≤60 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Anti-Rabies Virus Neutralizing Antibody Concentration
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 57).
primary_outcome.description: Assessment was made to demonstrate the non-inferiority of the geometric mean anti-rabies virus neutralizing antibody concentrations, 28 days after the vaccination of the second dose of Japanese encephalitis vaccine and third dose of rabies virus vaccine given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 or alone in healthy adults aged ≥18 years to ≤60 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages Of Subjects With Anti-YF Neutralizing Antibody Titers ≥ 1/10, 28 Days After The Vaccination Of Typhoid Vi Polysaccharide And Yellow Fever, Concomitantly With MenACWY-CRM197 Or Given Alone
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed as the percentages of subjects who achieved seroprotection as measured by neutralization test for anti-YF neutralizing antibody titers after the vaccination of typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever, given alone or concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 on day 29. Seroprotection is defined as percentages of subjects who achieved anti-YF neutralizing antibody titers ≥ 1/10 on day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages Of Subjects With Anti-JE Neutralizing Antibody Titers ≥ 1/10, 28 Days After The Vaccination Of The Last Doses Of Japanese Encephalitis And Rabies, Given Concomitantly With MenACWY-CRM197 Or Alone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 57).
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was measured as the percentages of subjects who achieved seroprotection as measured by neutralization test for anti-Japanese encephalitis neutralizing antibody titers, 28 days after administration of the second dose of Japanese encephalitis virus vaccine and 28 days after the vaccination of third dose of rabies virus vaccine, given alone or concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197. Seroprotection is defined as percentages of subjects who achieved anti-JE neutralizing titers ≥ 1/10 on Day 57.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages Of Subjects With Anti-Rabies Virus Antibody Concentrations ≥ 0.5 IU/mL 28 Days After the Vaccination Of The Last Doses Of Japanese Encephalitis And Rabies Virus, Given Concomitantly With MenACWY-CRM197 Or Alone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 57).
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed as the percentages of subjects who achieved seroprotection as measured by neutralization test for anti-rabies neutralizing antibody titers, 28 days after administration of the second dose of Japanese encephalitis virus vaccine and 28 days after the vaccination of third dose of rabies virus vaccine, given alone or concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197. Seroprotection is defined as a subject with a baseline hSBA titer < 1:4, seroresponse was defined as a post-vaccination hSBA titer ≥ 1:8; for a subject with a baseline hSBA titer ≥ 1:4, seroresponse was defined as a post-vaccination hSBA titer of at least 4 times the baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean hSBA Titers For Meningococcal Serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 Days After The Vaccination Of MenACWY-CRM197 Given Concomitantly With Typhoid Vi Polysaccharide And Yellow Fever Vaccines Alone
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed by Serum Bactericidal Assay using human complement (hSBA) geometric mean titers (GMTs) for meningococcal serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 days after administration of MenACWY-CRM197 given concomitantly with typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccines or alone.

secondary_outcome.measure: Seroresponse Rate For Meningococcal Serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 Days After Vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 Given Concomitantly With Typhoid Vi Polysaccharide and Yellow Fever Vaccines or Alone
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed by seroresponse rates as measured by human serum bactericidal activity (hSBA) titers for meningococcal serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 days after administration of MenACWY-CRM197 given concomitantly with typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccines or alone. Seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA titer ≥1:8; for a subject with a baseline hSBA titer ≥1:4, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA titer of at least four times the baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean hSBA Titers for Meningococcal Serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 Days After the Vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 Given Concomitantly With Japanese Encephalitis and Rabies Virus Vaccines or Alone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 29 or day 57).
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was measured by human serum bactericidal activity (hSBA) geometric mean titers (GMTs) for meningococcal serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 days after administration of MenACWY-CRM197 given concomitantly with Japanese encephalitis and rabies virus vaccines or alone.

secondary_outcome.measure: Seroresponse Rate for Meningococcal Serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 Days After Vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 Given Concomitantly With Japanese Encephalitis and Rabies Virus Vaccines or Alone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month post last vaccination (day 29 or day 57)
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed by seroresponse rates as measured by human serum bactericidal activity (hSBA) titers for meningococcal serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 days after administration of MenACWY-CRM197 given concomitantly with Japanese encephalitis and rabies virus vaccines or alone. Seroresponse is defined as a subject with a baseline hSBA titer < 1:4, seroresponse was defined as a post-vaccination hSBA titer ≥ 1:8; for a subject with a baseline hSBA titer ≥ 1:4, seroresponse was defined as a postvaccination hSBA titer of at least 4 times the baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Rabies Virus Neutralizing Antibody Concentration 28 Days After the Last Vaccination Of Rabies Virus Vaccine Concomitantly Either With Japanese Encephalitis or With Japanese Encephalitis And MenACWY-CRM197
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 57).
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity was assessed in rabies virus vaccine as measured by geometric mean rabies virus neutralizing antibody concentration, 28 days after vaccination of the third dose, when administered alone or concomitantly either with Japanese encephalitis vaccine or with Japanese Encephalitis and MenACWY-CRM197 vaccines.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With Anti-rabies Virus Concentrations ≥ 0.5 IU/mL, 28 Days After the Last Vaccination of Rabies Virus Vaccine Concomitantly Either With Japanese Encephalitis or With Japanese Encephalitis and MenACWY-CRM197
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 57).
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was measured as the percentages of subjects who achieved seroprotection of anti-rabies virus antibody concentrations 28 days after vaccination of the third dose of rabies virus vaccine, when administered alone or concomitantly either with Japanese encephalitis or with Japanese encephalitis and MenACWY-CRM197 vaccines. Seroprotection is defined as percentages of subjects who achieved anti-rabies virus antibody concentrations ≥ 0.5 IU/mL on day 57.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events of Special Interest After Any Vaccination of Japanese Encephalitis and Rabies Virus Vaccines Given Concomitantly With MenACWY-CRM197 or Alone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to day 57 post last vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: In addition to the AEs and SAEs. Additional AESI were collected from day 1 to day 57 postvaccination in subjects after the vaccination of Japanese encephalitis and rabies virus vaccines given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 or alone.

arm_group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccine.
Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide, yellow fever and meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.
Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese encephalitis and three doses of Rabies vaccine.
Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese encephalitis and three doses of Rabies and one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.
Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received three doses of Rabies vaccine.
Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

intervention.description: One dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide vaccine.
One dose of yellow fever vaccine.
Two doses of Japanese Encephalitis Vaccine.

facility.name: Centrum ockovani a cestovni mediciny (Vaccination and Travel Medicine Centre) Poliklinika II
Berliner Centrum Fur Reise und Tropenmedizin

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were enrolled at 5 sites (Berhard Nocht Institut, Germany, Berliner Centrum fuer Reise, Germany, Universitat Rostock, Germany, University of Munich, Germany, Vacc and Travel Med. Center, Czech Republic)
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All enrolled subjects were included in the trial.

group.title: TF+YF
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccine.

group.title: TF+YF+MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide, yellow fever and meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

group.title: JE+Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese encephalitis and three doses of Rabies vaccine.

group.title: JE+Rabies+MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese encephalitis and three doses of Rabies and one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

group.title: Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received three doses of Rabies vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM197 (Combined)
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

group.title: TF+YF
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccine.

group.title: TF+YF+MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide, yellow fever and meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

group.title: JE+Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese encephalitis and three doses of Rabies vaccine.

group.title: JE+Rabies+MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese encephalitis and three doses of Rabies and one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

group.title: Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received three doses of Rabies vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM197 (Combined)
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Anti-typhoid Vi Antibody Concentrations
outcome.description: Assessment was made to demonstrate the non-inferiority of the geometric mean anti-typhoid Vi antibody concentrations, 28 days after the vaccination of typhoid Vi polysaccharide (TF) and yellow fever (YF) vaccines given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 to typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccines given alone in healthy adults aged ≥18 years to ≤60 years.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the per-protocol (PP) set, ie, the subjects who received the vaccine correctly; provided evaluable serum samples at the relevant time points; and had no major protocol violations as defined prior to analysis.

group.title: TF+YF
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccine.

group.title: TF+YF+MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide, yellow fever and meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

measure.title: Geometric Mean Anti-typhoid Vi Antibody Concentrations
measure.description: Assessment was made to demonstrate the non-inferiority of the geometric mean anti-typhoid Vi antibody concentrations, 28 days after the vaccination of typhoid Vi polysaccharide (TF) and yellow fever (YF) vaccines given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 to typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccines given alone in healthy adults aged ≥18 years to ≤60 years.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the per-protocol (PP) set, ie, the subjects who received the vaccine correctly; provided evaluable serum samples at the relevant time points; and had no major protocol violations as defined prior to analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: The primary criterion for immunogenicity (postvaccination, day 29) was that the lower limit of the two-sided 95% confidence interval around the observed ratio of geometric mean concentrations between one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccines given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 to typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccines given alone was greater than 0.5.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Anti-Yellow Fever Antibody Titer
outcome.description: Assessment was made to demonstrate the non-inferiority of the geometric mean anti-yellow fever antibody titers, 28 days after the vaccination of typhoid Vi polysaccharide (TF) and yellow fever (YF) vaccines given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 to typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccines given alone in healthy adults aged ≥18 years to ≤60 years.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the per-protocol (PP) set, ie, the subjects who received the vaccine correctly; provided evaluable serum samples at the relevant time points; and had no major protocol violations as defined prior to analysis.

group.title: TF+YF
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccine.

group.title: TF+YF+MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide, yellow fever and meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

measure.title: Geometric Mean Anti-Yellow Fever Antibody Titer
measure.description: Assessment was made to demonstrate the non-inferiority of the geometric mean anti-yellow fever antibody titers, 28 days after the vaccination of typhoid Vi polysaccharide (TF) and yellow fever (YF) vaccines given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 to typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccines given alone in healthy adults aged ≥18 years to ≤60 years.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the per-protocol (PP) set, ie, the subjects who received the vaccine correctly; provided evaluable serum samples at the relevant time points; and had no major protocol violations as defined prior to analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: The primary criterion for immunogenicity (postvaccination, day 29) was that the lower limit of the two sided 95% CI around the observed ratio of geometric mean titers between one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccines given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 to typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccines given alone was greater than 0.5.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Anti-Japanese Encephalitis Neutralizing Antibody Titers
outcome.description: Assessment was made to demonstrate the non-inferiority of the geometric mean anti-Japanese encephalitis neutralizing antibody titers, 28 days after the vaccination of the second dose of Japanese Encephalitis vaccine and third dose of the rabies virus vaccine given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 or alone in healthy adults aged ≥18 years to ≤60 years.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 57).
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the PP set, i.e. the subjects who received the vaccine correctly; provided evaluable serum samples at the relevant time points; and had no major protocol violations as defined prior to analysis.

group.title: JE+Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of Rabies vaccine.

group.title: JE+Rab+MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of Rabies vaccine and one dose of Meningococcal conjugate vaccine.

measure.title: Geometric Mean Anti-Japanese Encephalitis Neutralizing Antibody Titers
measure.description: Assessment was made to demonstrate the non-inferiority of the geometric mean anti-Japanese encephalitis neutralizing antibody titers, 28 days after the vaccination of the second dose of Japanese Encephalitis vaccine and third dose of the rabies virus vaccine given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 or alone in healthy adults aged ≥18 years to ≤60 years.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the PP set, i.e. the subjects who received the vaccine correctly; provided evaluable serum samples at the relevant time points; and had no major protocol violations as defined prior to analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: The primary criterion for immunogenicity (postvaccination, day 57) was that the lower limit of the two sided 95% CI around the observed ratio of geometric mean titers between the second dose of Japanese Encephalitis and third dose of rabies virus vaccines given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 to Japanese Encephalitis and rabies virus vaccines given alone was greater than 0.5.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: GMT JE + Rab + MenACWY-CRM/GMT JE + Rab.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Anti-Rabies Virus Neutralizing Antibody Concentration
outcome.description: Assessment was made to demonstrate the non-inferiority of the geometric mean anti-rabies virus neutralizing antibody concentrations, 28 days after the vaccination of the second dose of Japanese encephalitis vaccine and third dose of rabies virus vaccine given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 or alone in healthy adults aged ≥18 years to ≤60 years.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 57).
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the per-protocol (PP) set, i.e. the subjects who received the vaccine correctly; provided evaluable serum samples at the relevant time points; and had no major protocol violations as defined prior to analysis.

group.title: JE+Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of Rabies vaccine.

group.title: JE+Rab+MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of Rabies vaccine and one dose of Meningococcal conjugate vaccine.

measure.title: Geometric Mean Anti-Rabies Virus Neutralizing Antibody Concentration
measure.description: Assessment was made to demonstrate the non-inferiority of the geometric mean anti-rabies virus neutralizing antibody concentrations, 28 days after the vaccination of the second dose of Japanese encephalitis vaccine and third dose of rabies virus vaccine given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 or alone in healthy adults aged ≥18 years to ≤60 years.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the per-protocol (PP) set, i.e. the subjects who received the vaccine correctly; provided evaluable serum samples at the relevant time points; and had no major protocol violations as defined prior to analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: The primary criterion for immunogenicity (postvaccination, day 57) was that the lower limit of the two sided 95% CI around the observed ratio of geometric mean concentrations between the second dose of Japanese encephalitis and third dose of rabies virus vaccines given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 to Japanese encephalitis and rabies virus vaccines given alone was greater than 0.5.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: GMC JE + Rab + MenACWY-CRM/GMC JE + Rab.

outcome.title: Percentages Of Subjects With Anti-YF Neutralizing Antibody Titers ≥ 1/10, 28 Days After The Vaccination Of Typhoid Vi Polysaccharide And Yellow Fever, Concomitantly With MenACWY-CRM197 Or Given Alone
outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed as the percentages of subjects who achieved seroprotection as measured by neutralization test for anti-YF neutralizing antibody titers after the vaccination of typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever, given alone or concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 on day 29. Seroprotection is defined as percentages of subjects who achieved anti-YF neutralizing antibody titers ≥ 1/10 on day 29.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the Modified-Intention to Treat (MITT) set, i.e. the subjects who provided evaluable serum samples whose assay results are available for at least one antigen on baseline and on at least one post-baseline visit.

group.title: TF+YF
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccine.

group.title: TF+YF+MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide, yellow fever and meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

measure.title: Percentages Of Subjects With Anti-YF Neutralizing Antibody Titers ≥ 1/10, 28 Days After The Vaccination Of Typhoid Vi Polysaccharide And Yellow Fever, Concomitantly With MenACWY-CRM197 Or Given Alone
measure.description: Immunogenicity was assessed as the percentages of subjects who achieved seroprotection as measured by neutralization test for anti-YF neutralizing antibody titers after the vaccination of typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever, given alone or concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 on day 29. Seroprotection is defined as percentages of subjects who achieved anti-YF neutralizing antibody titers ≥ 1/10 on day 29.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the Modified-Intention to Treat (MITT) set, i.e. the subjects who provided evaluable serum samples whose assay results are available for at least one antigen on baseline and on at least one post-baseline visit.

outcome.title: Percentages Of Subjects With Anti-JE Neutralizing Antibody Titers ≥ 1/10, 28 Days After The Vaccination Of The Last Doses Of Japanese Encephalitis And Rabies, Given Concomitantly With MenACWY-CRM197 Or Alone
outcome.description: Immunogenicity was measured as the percentages of subjects who achieved seroprotection as measured by neutralization test for anti-Japanese encephalitis neutralizing antibody titers, 28 days after administration of the second dose of Japanese encephalitis virus vaccine and 28 days after the vaccination of third dose of rabies virus vaccine, given alone or concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197. Seroprotection is defined as percentages of subjects who achieved anti-JE neutralizing titers ≥ 1/10 on Day 57.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 57).
outcome.population: The analysis was done on the MITT data set.

group.title: JE+Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of Rabies vaccine.

group.title: JE+Rabies+MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of Rabies and one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

measure.title: Percentages Of Subjects With Anti-JE Neutralizing Antibody Titers ≥ 1/10, 28 Days After The Vaccination Of The Last Doses Of Japanese Encephalitis And Rabies, Given Concomitantly With MenACWY-CRM197 Or Alone
measure.description: Immunogenicity was measured as the percentages of subjects who achieved seroprotection as measured by neutralization test for anti-Japanese encephalitis neutralizing antibody titers, 28 days after administration of the second dose of Japanese encephalitis virus vaccine and 28 days after the vaccination of third dose of rabies virus vaccine, given alone or concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197. Seroprotection is defined as percentages of subjects who achieved anti-JE neutralizing titers ≥ 1/10 on Day 57.
measure.population: The analysis was done on the MITT data set.

outcome.title: Percentages Of Subjects With Anti-Rabies Virus Antibody Concentrations ≥ 0.5 IU/mL 28 Days After the Vaccination Of The Last Doses Of Japanese Encephalitis And Rabies Virus, Given Concomitantly With MenACWY-CRM197 Or Alone
outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed as the percentages of subjects who achieved seroprotection as measured by neutralization test for anti-rabies neutralizing antibody titers, 28 days after administration of the second dose of Japanese encephalitis virus vaccine and 28 days after the vaccination of third dose of rabies virus vaccine, given alone or concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197. Seroprotection is defined as a subject with a baseline hSBA titer < 1:4, seroresponse was defined as a post-vaccination hSBA titer ≥ 1:8; for a subject with a baseline hSBA titer ≥ 1:4, seroresponse was defined as a post-vaccination hSBA titer of at least 4 times the baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 57).
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the MITT data set.

Seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA titer ≥1:8; for a subject with a baseline hSBA titer ≥1:4, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA titer of at least four times the baseline.
measure.population: The analysis was done on the MITT data set.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean hSBA Titers for Meningococcal Serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 Days After the Vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 Given Concomitantly With Japanese Encephalitis and Rabies Virus Vaccines or Alone
outcome.description: Immunogenicity was measured by human serum bactericidal activity (hSBA) geometric mean titers (GMTs) for meningococcal serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 days after administration of MenACWY-CRM197 given concomitantly with Japanese encephalitis and rabies virus vaccines or alone.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 29 or day 57).
outcome.population: The analysis was done on the MITT data set.

group.title: JE + Rab + MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of Rabies and one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM197 (Combined)
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

measure.title: Geometric Mean hSBA Titers for Meningococcal Serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 Days After the Vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 Given Concomitantly With Japanese Encephalitis and Rabies Virus Vaccines or Alone
measure.description: Immunogenicity was measured by human serum bactericidal activity (hSBA) geometric mean titers (GMTs) for meningococcal serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 days after administration of MenACWY-CRM197 given concomitantly with Japanese encephalitis and rabies virus vaccines or alone.
measure.population: The analysis was done on the MITT data set.

outcome.title: Seroresponse Rate for Meningococcal Serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 Days After Vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 Given Concomitantly With Japanese Encephalitis and Rabies Virus Vaccines or Alone
outcome.description: Immunogenicity was assessed by seroresponse rates as measured by human serum bactericidal activity (hSBA) titers for meningococcal serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 days after administration of MenACWY-CRM197 given concomitantly with Japanese encephalitis and rabies virus vaccines or alone. Seroresponse is defined as a subject with a baseline hSBA titer < 1:4, seroresponse was defined as a post-vaccination hSBA titer ≥ 1:8; for a subject with a baseline hSBA titer ≥ 1:4, seroresponse was defined as a postvaccination hSBA titer of at least 4 times the baseline.
outcome.time_frame: 1 month post last vaccination (day 29 or day 57)
outcome.population: The analysis was done on the MITT data set.

group.title: JE + Rab + MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of Rabies and one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM197 (Combined)
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

measure.title: Seroresponse Rate for Meningococcal Serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 Days After Vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 Given Concomitantly With Japanese Encephalitis and Rabies Virus Vaccines or Alone
measure.description: Immunogenicity was assessed by seroresponse rates as measured by human serum bactericidal activity (hSBA) titers for meningococcal serogroups A,C,W,Y 28 days after administration of MenACWY-CRM197 given concomitantly with Japanese encephalitis and rabies virus vaccines or alone. Seroresponse is defined as a subject with a baseline hSBA titer < 1:4, seroresponse was defined as a post-vaccination hSBA titer ≥ 1:8; for a subject with a baseline hSBA titer ≥ 1:4, seroresponse was defined as a postvaccination hSBA titer of at least 4 times the baseline.
measure.population: The analysis was done on the MITT data set.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Rabies Virus Neutralizing Antibody Concentration 28 Days After the Last Vaccination Of Rabies Virus Vaccine Concomitantly Either With Japanese Encephalitis or With Japanese Encephalitis And MenACWY-CRM197
outcome.description: The immunogenicity was assessed in rabies virus vaccine as measured by geometric mean rabies virus neutralizing antibody concentration, 28 days after vaccination of the third dose, when administered alone or concomitantly either with Japanese encephalitis vaccine or with Japanese Encephalitis and MenACWY-CRM197 vaccines.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 57).
outcome.population: The analysis was done on the MITT data set.

group.title: JE + Rabies + MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of Rabies and one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

group.title: JE + Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of rabies vaccine.

group.title: Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received three doses of Rabies vaccine

measure.title: Geometric Mean Rabies Virus Neutralizing Antibody Concentration 28 Days After the Last Vaccination Of Rabies Virus Vaccine Concomitantly Either With Japanese Encephalitis or With Japanese Encephalitis And MenACWY-CRM197
measure.description: The immunogenicity was assessed in rabies virus vaccine as measured by geometric mean rabies virus neutralizing antibody concentration, 28 days after vaccination of the third dose, when administered alone or concomitantly either with Japanese encephalitis vaccine or with Japanese Encephalitis and MenACWY-CRM197 vaccines.
measure.population: The analysis was done on the MITT data set.

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects With Anti-rabies Virus Concentrations ≥ 0.5 IU/mL, 28 Days After the Last Vaccination of Rabies Virus Vaccine Concomitantly Either With Japanese Encephalitis or With Japanese Encephalitis and MenACWY-CRM197
outcome.description: Immunogenicity was measured as the percentages of subjects who achieved seroprotection of anti-rabies virus antibody concentrations 28 days after vaccination of the third dose of rabies virus vaccine, when administered alone or concomitantly either with Japanese encephalitis or with Japanese encephalitis and MenACWY-CRM197 vaccines. Seroprotection is defined as percentages of subjects who achieved anti-rabies virus antibody concentrations ≥ 0.5 IU/mL on day 57.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 month post last vaccination (day 57).
outcome.population: The analysis was done on the MITT data set.

group.title: JE + Rabies + MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of Rabies and one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

group.title: JE + Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of Rabies vaccine.

group.title: Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 yars of age who received three doses of Rabies vaccine.

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects With Anti-rabies Virus Concentrations ≥ 0.5 IU/mL, 28 Days After the Last Vaccination of Rabies Virus Vaccine Concomitantly Either With Japanese Encephalitis or With Japanese Encephalitis and MenACWY-CRM197
measure.description: Immunogenicity was measured as the percentages of subjects who achieved seroprotection of anti-rabies virus antibody concentrations 28 days after vaccination of the third dose of rabies virus vaccine, when administered alone or concomitantly either with Japanese encephalitis or with Japanese encephalitis and MenACWY-CRM197 vaccines. Seroprotection is defined as percentages of subjects who achieved anti-rabies virus antibody concentrations ≥ 0.5 IU/mL on day 57.
measure.population: The analysis was done on the MITT data set.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events of Special Interest After Any Vaccination of Japanese Encephalitis and Rabies Virus Vaccines Given Concomitantly With MenACWY-CRM197 or Alone
outcome.description: In addition to the AEs and SAEs. Additional AESI were collected from day 1 to day 57 postvaccination in subjects after the vaccination of Japanese encephalitis and rabies virus vaccines given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 or alone.
outcome.time_frame: day 1 to day 57 post last vaccination
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the safety data set, i.e. the subjects in the exposed population who provided postvaccination safety data.

group.title: JE + Rabies + MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of Rabies and one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

group.title: JE + Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese Encephalitis and three doses of Rabies vaccine.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events of Special Interest After Any Vaccination of Japanese Encephalitis and Rabies Virus Vaccines Given Concomitantly With MenACWY-CRM197 or Alone
measure.description: In addition to the AEs and SAEs. Additional AESI were collected from day 1 to day 57 postvaccination in subjects after the vaccination of Japanese encephalitis and rabies virus vaccines given concomitantly with MenACWY-CRM197 or alone.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the safety data set, i.e. the subjects in the exposed population who provided postvaccination safety data.

reported_events.time_frame: day 1 to day 29 (one month postvaccination); day 1 to day 57 (one month post last vaccination)
reported_events.desc: AEs and SAEs were collected from day 1-29 for subjects vaccinated with typhoid Vi polysaccharide+YF +MenACWY-CRM197 or alone, from day 1-57 vaccinated with JE+rabies virus+MenACWY-CRM197 or alone and who received rabies vaccine alone.

group.title: TF+YF
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide and yellow fever vaccine.

group.title: TF+YF+MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of typhoid Vi polysaccharide, yellow fever and meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

group.title: JE+Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese encephalitis and three doses of Rabies vaccine.

group.title: JE+Rabies+MenACWY-CRM197
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received two doses of Japanese encephalitis and three doses of Rabies and one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

group.title: Rabies
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received three doses of Rabies vaccine.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM197 (Combined)
group.description: Subjects ≥18 years to ≤60 years of age who received one dose of meningococcal ACWY conjugate vaccine.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
